Bash(python -c "
import sys
import os
from pathlib import Path

# Add src to Python path to allow imports
src_path = Path\(__file__\).parent / ''src''
sys.path.insert\(0, str\(src_path\)\)

# Test the models specifically
from src.models.conversation import Conversation
from src.models.user_query import UserQuery
from src.models.chatbot_response import ChatbotResponse

print\(''Testing Conversation model attributes...''\)
conversation_attrs = [''id'', ''session_id'', ''user_id'', ''title'', ''created_at'', ''updated_at'', ''conversation_metadata'']
for attr in conversation_attrs:
    has_attr = hasattr\(Conversation, attr\)
    print\(f''Conversation model has \\''{attr}\\'': {has_attr}''\)

print\(\)
print\(''Testing UserQuery model attributes...''\)
user_query_attrs = [''id'', ''session_id'', ''query_text'', ''query_type'', ''conversation_id'']
for attr in user_query_attrs:
    has_attr = hasattr\(UserQuery, attr\)
    print\(f''UserQuery model has \\''{attr}\\'': {has_attr}''\)

print\(\)
print\(''Testing ChatbotResponse model attributes...''\)
response_attrs = [''id'', ''query_id'', ''response_text'']
for attr in response_attrs:
    has_attr = hasattr\(ChatbotResponse, attr\)
    print\(f''ChatbotResponse model has \\''{attr}\\'': {has_attr}''\)

print\(\)
print\(''All model attributes are present!''\)
")

Bash(python -c "
import sys
from pathlib import Path
sys.path.insert\(0, str\(Path\(''.''\).absolute\(\)\)\)

# Test just the models and API structure without the logging dependency
import importlib.util

# Load the rag_api module directly to check for the conversation endpoints
spec = importlib.util.spec_from_file_location\(''rag_api'', ''./api/rag_api.py''\)
rag_api_module = importlib.util.module_from_spec\(spec\)

# Mock the imports that are causing issues
import sys
class MockJsonLogger:
    JsonFormatter = object

class MockModule:
    jsonlogger = MockJsonLogger\(\)

sys.modules[''pythonjsonlogger''] = MockModule\(\)
sys.modules[''src.utils.logging_config''] = MockModule\(\)

# Now try to load the module
try:
    spec.loader.exec_module\(rag_api_module\)
    print\(''API module loaded successfully with conversation endpoints''\)
    
    # Check if the router exists
    if hasattr\(rag_api_module, ''router''\):
        print\(''Router exists in module''\)
        
        # Check if routes are registered by looking at the router''s attributes
        routes = [route for route in rag_api_module.router.routes]
        route_paths = [getattr\(route, ''path'', ''unknown''\) for route in routes]
        print\(''Registered paths:'', route_paths\)
        
        # Check for conversation endpoints specifically
        conv_endpoints = [path for path in route_paths if ''conversation'' in path.lower\(\)]
        print\(''Conversation-related endpoints found:'', conv_endpoints\)
    else:
        print\(''Router not found in module''\)
        
except Exception as e:
    print\(f''Error loading API module: {e}''\)
    import traceback
    traceback.print_exc\(\)
")

Bash(python -c "
import sys
from pathlib import Path
sys.path.insert\(0, str\(Path\(''.''\).absolute\(\) / ''src''\)\)

# Test the ChatService with mocked dependencies to check field compatibility
import importlib.util

# Create mock modules for dependencies that are causing import issues
class MockJsonLogger:
    JsonFormatter = object

class MockLoggingModule:
    def setup_logging\(self, debug=False\):
        pass
    def get_logger\(self, name\):
        import logging
        return logging.getLogger\(name\)

class MockDatabase:
    SessionLocal = object
    engine = object
    def get_db\(self\):
        yield object\(\)

class MockQdrant:
    def __init__\(self\):
        pass

class MockOpenAI:
    def __init__\(self\):
        pass

# Add mocks to sys.modules
import sys
sys.modules[''pythonjsonlogger''] = type\(''Module'', \(\), {''jsonlogger'': MockJsonLogger}\)\(\)
sys.modules[''src.utils.logging_config''] = MockLoggingModule\(\)
sys.modules[''src.database.database''] = MockDatabase\(\)
sys.modules[''src.vector_store.qdrant_client''] = MockQdrant\(\)
sys.modules[''src.ai.openai_client''] = MockOpenAI\(\)

# Now try to test the service
try:
    from src.services.chat_service import ChatService
    print\(''ChatService class loaded successfully''\)
    
    # Check if the service has the expected methods
    methods = [''create_conversation'', ''process_query'', ''get_conversation'', ''get_chat_history'']
    for method in methods:
        has_method = hasattr\(ChatService, method\)
        print\(f''ChatService has {method}: {has_method}''\)
        
    print\(''Service structure verification completed successfully''\)
    
except Exception as e:
    print\(f''Error loading ChatService: {e}''\)
    import traceback
    traceback.print_exc\(\)
")

import sys
from pathlib import Path
sys.path.insert\(0, str\(Path\(''.''\).absolute\(\) / ''src''\)\)

# Try to import the main app
try:
    from src.main import app
    print\(''Main app imported successfully''\)
    print\(''App title:'', app.title if hasattr\(app, ''title''\) else ''No title''\)
    
    # Check if routes are registered
    route_paths = [route.path for route in app.routes]
    print\(''Number of routes:'', len\(route_paths\)\)
    print\(''Sample routes:'', route_paths[:10] if len\(route_paths\) > 10 else route_paths\)
    
except Exception as e:
    print\(f''Error importing main app: {e}''\)
    import traceback
    traceback.print_exc\(\)
")
